resource.chars:
The “Elaeoblast” of the Salpae appears to be 
represented in the solitary ascidians by the 
calcareous mass in contact with the heart 
described by Van Beneden in Cynthia ampulloides 
<s>The circlet  of tentacles in the ordinary 
ascidians seems to be represented by the ciliated band 
which encircles the buccal orifice in Salpa 
& Pyrosoma <\s>
The simple epipharyngeal & hypopharyngeal bands of the Salpa 
have been traced through their first degree 
of complication in Doliolum to Pyrosoma 
& Botryllus where they form a true branchial sac -
differing from that of the simple ascidians 
only in the number & size of its meshes -
On the other hand in Pelonaia the 
hypopharyngeal band itself has disappeared 
It is a Salpa in which the oral & cloacal 
orifices have <s>become <\s> approximated while 
the “gill” has become obliterated * -
In the strange form, Appendicularia,
the simplification is carried a step farther 
In these there is but one orifice - the oral - The 
anus opens on the dorsal surface - and 
a long appendage is added in the same position 
as that of Botterina - but instead of being 
a long pedicle of attachment, it is a
free and energetically moving fin -
